quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Wimbledon and Title
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, title, players. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With whom of these tennis players has Martina Navratilova not won a Wimbledon Ladies doubles title?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gigi Fernandez

questions.question: What are the official colors of the Wimbledon tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: purple and green

questions.question: The Romanian gymnastics team won the all around team gold at the 1976 Olympic Games in Montreal, Canada.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On what surface is the Wimbledon tournament played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: grass

questions.question: Which of these former gymnasts is the most decorated male gymnast in the Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sawao Kato (japan)

questions.question: Who was the first US female gymnast to win the all around gold at a fully-attended Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carly Patterson

questions.question: In 1985, this tennis player, only 17-years-old at the time, became the first unseeded contestant to win the Mens singles title at Wimbledon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boris Becker

questions.question: Between which two tournaments is Wimbledon played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: French Open and US Open

questions.question: The winner of the Ladies singles title at Wimbledon is awarded a silver plate with beautiful motifs. What is its nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosewater Dish

questions.question: In its very first year, 1877, Wimbledon began with 22 contestants, competing for this title.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mens singles title

questions.question: This Grand Slam winner won her first out of a total of seven Ladies singles Wimbledon titles in 1988.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steffi Graf

questions.question: Which of these former gymnasts won the most medals in the Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larissa Latynina (Russia)

questions.question: Who was the first lady to win 6 consecutive Ladies singles titles at Wimbledon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martina Navratilova

questions.question: What gymnastics team won the all around gold medal at the 2008 Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: In 2001 this player became the first ever wild card entry to win the Wimbledon tournament.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goran Ivanišević

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Steelers and Pitcher
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, stadium, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was  the first pitcher to earn the Triple Crown four times?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland Alexander

questions.question: The Steelers lost their first playoff game against this team in 1947.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philadelphia Eagles

questions.question: During World War II, the Steelers merged with these two other teams because of a shortage of war time players.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cardinals and Eagles

questions.question: Who became head coach of the Steelers in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Cowher

questions.question: The Steelers lost their bid for a fifth Championship in Super Bowl XXX to this team in January 1996.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas Cowboys

questions.question: This Hall of Fame Quarterback led the Steelers to 4 Super Bowl victories in the 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Bradshaw

questions.question: The Steelers finally won their 5th Championship in Super Bowl XL against the Seattle Seahawks in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2006

questions.question: Tommy Bond was the first pitcher to qualify as a Triple Crown winner, but this great pitcher was the first to win it in the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cy Young

questions.question: This player, drafted by The Steelers in 1969, is widely known for being mean and a for Coke commercial with a little kid.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Green

questions.question: This left-handed pitcher, who was also a basketball player, won the National  League Triple Crown for the Dodgers in 1963, 1965, and 1966.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandy Koufax

questions.question: The Steelers began playing at this Stadium in the 2001 season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heinz Field

questions.question: The Pittsburgh Steelers are the oldest team in the American Conference. What year were they formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1933

questions.question: This man was the head coach of the Pittsburgh Steelers from 1969 through 1991.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Noll

questions.question: To win the pitching Triple Crown, a pitcher must lead his league in these categories.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wins, ERA, strikeouts

questions.question: In the 1930s two American League pitchers won the Triple Crown twice each. They both had the same nickname. What were their last names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grove and Gomez

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Basketball and Nba
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, coach. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what year did the first televised basketball game air?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1940

questions.question: What was the original name for basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Naismithball

questions.question: In the very first basketball game each team comprised of this many players.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: He won the Triple Crown in 2006 and was traded after the next season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johan Santana

questions.question: What team was formed by Abe Saperstein?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harlem Globetrotters

questions.question: In what state was the first college basketball game played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minnesota

questions.question: During modern baseball (i.e. since 1877) this is the first decade in which no pitcher could earn the Triple Crown.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1950s

questions.question: Who is given credit for taking the first jump shot in college basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ken Sailors

questions.question: Glory Road is a movie about the first NCAA basketball team with an all African-American starting lineup. Which university is the movie about?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas Western

questions.question: Who scored the first basket in the NBA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzie Schectman

questions.question: Who was the first NBA player to score 60 points in a game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Fulks

questions.question: The Philadelphia Warriors became the first NBA champions in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1947

questions.question: Who was the first college coach of a five-man basketball team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amos Alonzo Stagg

questions.question: This movie tells the story of a woman who becomes the coach of the New York Knicks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie

questions.question: This great NBA guard played from 1958–1967 for the Boston Celtics. For many years he was the best defensive guard in the NBA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: K.C. Jones

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: College and Football
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, basketball, leslie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the score of Penn State Nittany Lions in the first game of the 2008-2009 season vs. Coastal Carolina?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 66-10, Penn State won

questions.question: In 1992, 1984, and 2005, who was Penn State Nittany Lions football teams head coach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Paterno

questions.question: Where was Michael Fred Phelps born and raised?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baltimore, Md

questions.question: Where did Michael Phelps attend college?

options.text: University of Michigan in Ann Arbor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Michigan in Ann Arbor

questions.question: What conference is the Penn State Nittany Lions football team in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big Ten

questions.question: Which of the following players has won a Heisman Trophy in 1973 while in the Pennsylvania State University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Cappelletti

questions.question: What was the first college to win both the NCAA championship and the National Invitation Tournament in the same year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: City College of New York

questions.question: In what state was the first womens college basketball game played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: California

questions.question: What was the first college to win the NCAA championship in basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oregon

questions.question: Penn State Nittany Lions American football players wear a blue jersey at home.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: By which team was former Penn State Nittany Lions player Michael Robinson chosen in the NFL Draft in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco 49ers

questions.question: In1986 the Penn State Nittany Lions football team won their which National Championship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Second

questions.question: Find the true statement about Lisa Leslie.

options.text: She was the first leading scorer in the WNBA.
She was the first woman to play in the NBA.
She was the first woman to dunk a basketball in the WNBA.
She was the first woman to score 60 points in a WNBA game.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was the first woman to dunk a basketball in the WNBA.

questions.question: Does Penn State Nittany Lions football team have unbeaten, untied seasons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What is Penn State Nittany Lions football teams annual scrimmage game called?

options.text: Useless Pre-Season Game that is Fun to Go to

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue and White Game

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Michael Phelps and Sport
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athlete, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 2004 Olympic Games, Michael Phelps set a number of world records, Olympic records, and American records. How many of each did he set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 WR, 3 OR, and 2 AR

questions.question: Who was the first switch hitter in the Baseball Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frankie Frisch

questions.question: In the 2004 Athens Summer Olympic Games, how many gold and bronze medals did Michael Phelps win?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 gold, 2 bronze

questions.question: Michael Phelps first competed in Olympic Games in 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: A street in Michael Phelps hometown was renamed this to honor him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Phelps Way

questions.question: In the 100 m butterfly at  the 2008 Olympic Games, Michael Phelps beat Milorad Čavić by this much.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1/100th of a second

questions.question: Stella Walsh was a Polish-born athlete residing in Cleveland, Ohio. She won an Olympic gold medal in  the 1932 Olympic (100 meters) and a silver medal in the 1936 Olympics (100 meters). Which statement is untrue about Stella Walsh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She had female genitalia

questions.question: The  sport of noodling has become very popular in the USA. What does it involve?

options.text: Pushing an enormous plastic ball into your opponents goal
A form of mixed martial arts with no rules

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catching catfish barehanded

questions.question: There was  a sport called face-slapping.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was the first NFL Super Bowl MVP who was not born in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Rypien

questions.question: Which statement regarding the 1959 season is false?

options.text: Frank Robinson was the American League manager.
Orlando Cepeda and Stan Musial were the starting All-Star first basemen.
The American League lost the All-Star Game on July 7 5 to 4.
The National League lost the All Star Game on August 3  5 to 3.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Robinson was the American League manager.

questions.question: In the 2008 Olympic Games, Michael Phelps swam in 8 events. How many world records did Phelps and/or his team set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: Which was the first NFL team to have an insignia put on its helmets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rams

questions.question: Who were the  people on the first cover of Sports Illustrated?

options.text: Eddie Mathews, Wes Westrum and Augie Donatelli
Ben Hogan, Bobby Jones, and Sam Snead
President Dwight David Eisenhower and his caddy, Mitch MacKenzie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Mathews, Wes Westrum and Augie Donatelli

questions.question: Eddie Feigner, Cat Osterman, and Lisa Fernandez became well known for practicing this sport.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Softball

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Charlotte Bobcats and Yards
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, coach, one. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was the first person to hold the worlds record for running 50 yards, 75 yards and 100 yards backwards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Robinson

questions.question: When the Charlotte Bobcats first came into the NBA, how many NBA players did they pick to be on the inaugural roster in their expansion draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 19

questions.question: In 1952 Pete and Jerry Cusimano did this at a hockey game.

options.text: They were the first fans to jump onto the ice to protest a penalty on their team.
They were the first to place plexiglass to separate the fans from the players and ice rink.
They were the first to throw their hats onto the ice when a player scored three goals in one game.
They threw an octopus on the ice at an NHL game.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They threw an octopus on the ice at an NHL game.

questions.question: With the 2nd overall pick in the 2004 NBA draft, the Charlotte Bobcats selected what former UConn player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emeka Okafor

questions.question: Name the last Negro League baseball player to play in the major leagues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Aaron

questions.question: Find the incorrect statement about sportsman Yuichiro Miura.

options.text: He was the first seventy-year old person to climb Mount Fuji.
He climbed Mount Everest at the age of 75 years 7 months.
He was the first seventy-year old person to climb Mount Everest.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first seventy-year old person to climb Mount Fuji.

questions.question: Select the one who does not  fit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brian Leetch (NHL)

questions.question: Who was the Charlotte Bobcats first head coach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bernie Bickerstaff

questions.question: What was the Charlotte Bobcats record for their very 1st season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 18-64

questions.question: Besides basketball, is there any other type of sport played at the Charlotte Arena?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Before the Bobcats, what NBA team played in Charlotte?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Orleans Hornets

questions.question: Jerome Holtzman was a sports journalist of some repute. Which statement is true about him?

options.text: He and Bill James wrote many books using statistics to evaluate players.
He was the writer who wrote the original expose on steroids in baseball.
He was President of the Baseball Hall of Fame from 1999 to his death in 2008.
He invented the statistic Saves by a relief pitcher.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He invented the statistic Saves by a relief pitcher.

questions.question: Who built the tennis court that is in the Hampton Court in England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Henry VIII

questions.question: The Charlotte Bobcats lost their very first regular season game to what team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington Wizards

questions.question: Besides the Charlotte Bobcats, there is another professional basketball team in Charlotte.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True
